rationale: Both fields refer to unique sample identifiers. 'donor_id' refers to a donor, while 'parent_sample_id' refers to the sample used for the assay. They represent slightly different entities.
'tissue_id' refers to the display ID of the assayed tissue, whereas 'parent_sample_id' refers to the sample used for the assay. They are related but represent different levels of specificity.
No direct equivalent field for capturing the start date and time of the assay.
Both fields represent the DOI for the protocols used in the assay, with identical meanings.
No direct match for the person responsible for the assay execution in the target schema.
No corresponding field for the operator's email in the target schema.
No direct match for the principal investigator's name in the target schema.
No corresponding field for the principal investigator's email in the target schema.
'assay_category' categorizes the assay by its scientific technique, while 'dataset_type' refers to the specific type of dataset being produced. The source is broader.
'assay_type' and 'dataset_type' both represent the specific type of assay being conducted, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the analyte being measured, with no difference in definition.
Both fields capture whether the assay targets specific molecules, with identical definitions.
Both fields refer to the vendor of the acquisition instrument, with no difference in meaning.
Both fields represent the model of the acquisition instrument used in the assay, making this an exact match.
'bulk_rna_isolation_protocols_io_doi' specifically refers to RNA isolation protocols, while 'preparation_protocol_doi' refers to the assay preparation protocol, which may include RNA isolation.
No corresponding field for capturing the RNA yield in the target schema.
No direct match for the RNA yield units per tissue in the target schema.
No corresponding field for RNA quality metric (RIN value) in the target schema.
Both fields represent the amount of RNA input to the assay, with identical meanings.
Both fields describe the units of RNA input to the assay, making this an exact match.
'rnaseq_assay_method' refers to the RNA sequencing kit, while 'library_preparation_kit' refers to the kit used for library preparation. These are closely related but not exactly the same.

'library_construction_protocols_io_doi' refers to the library construction protocol, while 'preparation_protocol_doi' refers to the broader assay preparation protocol, which may include library construction.
Both fields represent whether the library was generated for single-end or paired-end sequencing, with identical definitions.
Both fields refer to the adapter sequences used for trimming during library preparation, making this an exact match.
Both fields refer to the number of PCR cycles used for indexing during library construction, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the total yield of the library after PCR amplification, with identical meanings.
Both fields describe the units of the final library yield, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the average fragment size of the library, making this an exact match.
Both fields refer to the reagent kit used for sequencing, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the number of sequencing cycles per round of sequencing, making this an exact match.
No direct equivalent field for capturing the percentage of Q30 in the target schema.
No direct match for capturing the PhiX percentage in the target schema.
Both fields refer to the relative path to the file containing contributor information (e.g., ORCID IDs), making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the relative path to the data files or directories, making this an exact match.
